body: Good catch. That was an oversight when renaming a function in #8286.  Sorry, my bad.  A fix is imminent.

issue.title: gui: Fix use of old, renamed function in edit folder sharing tab (fixes #8369)

issue.body: The function `deviceNameMarkUnaccepted()` was renamed to `deviceNameMarkRemoteState()`, but this one caller was not adjusted accordingly.  See #8369 for the respective defect.

body: Should this issue be labeled with "skip-changelog"? The problem is present only in the RCs of v1.20.2.
Yeah. It's a bit late in the cycle, but the changes are small; I'll drop an .rc-3 tomorrow.

v1.20.2
Fixed in Edit Folder -> Sharing
But still not fixed in Edit Device -> Sharing

issue.title: gui: Fix missing folder names in Edit Device > Sharing tab (fixes #8369)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Another renamed function missed from the previous PR #8286 somehow.  Fixes #8369 again.

I'm clueless as to how this could have got lost originally.  I did test the code, but either there were some merge conflicts where I messed things up or my browser had somehow cached the old functions, thus I didn't notice the missing labels. Note to self (and reviewers): When renaming something, do a recursive grep for the old name over the entire code base as a last step.

issue.body:
- syncthing-1.20.2-1 and Arch
- Firefox 101.0.1 and Chromium 102.0.5005.115
- the names of the folders I have shared on the second PC are not displayed. the names are in plain English
- go to Edit device > Provisioning > "View list of shared folders. folders that I have not exchanged with the names.
